thread.title: BSE Sensex trades over 200 points; NSE Nifty above 8,450
thread.title_full: BSE Sensex trades over 200 points; NSE Nifty above 8,450 | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: BSE Sensex trades over 200 points; NSE Nifty above 8,450
text:
Other Articles Stocks that are in focus today: Kotak Mahindra, RIL, ICICI Bank Market Outlook: BSE Sensex, NSE Nifty to remain green despite mixed global trends RBI expands loan recast forbearance for NBFCs The benchmark BSE Sensex , NSE Nifty opened in green on Friday, thereby continuing Thursday’s winning streak despite mixed global trends today.
Sensex traded over 200 points up and NSE Nifty traded above 8,450 in early trade.
At 9:42 am, BSE Sensex traded 237.50 points at 27,942.85. NSE Nifty traded 57.30 points at 8479.10
At 9:20 am, BSE Sensex traded 219.04 points at 27,924.39. NSE Nifty traded 35.55 points at 8,457.35
The benchmark BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty ended in green on Thursday for a second consecutive day after the cabinet approved a bill on the goods and services tax that incorporates recommendations from a parliamentary panel, and after the Federal Reserve meeting ended with no major surprises.
The BSE Sensex closed 141.92 points or 0.51% higher while the NSE Nifty was up by 46.75 points or 0.56% on Thursday.
World Market:
MSCI’s broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan was up about 0.1 percent in early trading, but set for a weekly loss of more than 1 percent.
Japan’s Nikkei stock index was down about 0.2 percent, poised to log a 0.3 percent loss for the week.
On Wall Street, US shares put in a mixed performance, as downbeat earnings offset solid economic data.
Crude oil was under pressure after dropping overnight in line with a stronger dollar, which makes dollar-denominated commodities less appealing to investors holding other currencies. US crude was slightly down at $48.49 a barrel.
The stronger greenback also pushed down gold, which plunged 1 percent with a 5-1/2-year low in sight. Spot gold was last steady on the day at $1,088.21 per ounce.
 31, 2015 9:02 am
